radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions have decreased in size since the previous examination. Mild adjacent compressive atelectasis is noted. No pericardial effusion and the heart size is top-normal. A 1.2 cm segment IV lesion unchanged, previously characterized as a hemangioma. Normal liver density with no intra or extrahepatic bile duct dilation. Decompressed gallbladder with a subcentimeter gallstone. Normal pancreatic density with mild atrophy. Normal spleen size with no focal lesions. Normal adrenal glands. Normal kidneys with a 1.2 x 1.4 cm right interpolar renal lesion unchanged over multiple prior examinations. Subcentimeter hypodensity along lower pole of left kidney unchanged. Normal caliber of stomach and bowel. Mildly distended bladder. Normal uterus without concerning adnexal lesions. Presacral collection has no appreciable residual fluid. Mild anterolisthesis of L4 over L5 and minimal retrolisthesis of L5 over S1 unchanged. Extensive atherosclerotic calcifications throughout the abdominal aorta and iliac branches without stenosis or dissection.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Small bilateral pleural effusions have decreased in size since the previous examination. A previously-seen presacral collection no longer demonstrates any appreciable residual fluid. Ongoing findings such as the renal lesion and the changes in lumbar vertebrae position were unchanged.
